ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They said, 'Alas for us! We were indeed wrongdoers!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Woe, alas," they said, "we were really sinful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They said: "Woe to us; surely we were wrong-doers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They said, "Woe to us! We have been unjust".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They cried, “Woe to us, we were indeed unjust!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They cried: "Woe to us! Certainly we have been wrongdoers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They said: O woe to us! surely we were unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: They said, 'Alas for us! We have been evildoers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They cried: Alas for us! we were wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They said, "Woe to us! We were indeed wrongdoers,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They said: woe unto us! verily we have been wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They said, ‘Woe to us! We have indeed been wrongdoers!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They said: "Ah! woe to us! We were indeed wrong-doers!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They cried: "Woe to us! Certainly! We have been Zalimun (polytheists, wrong-doers and disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah, etc.)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They said: 'Alas for us we were harmdoers'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They said, “Woe to us; we were unfair.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They said, "O woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:14] They said, ‘O (yā is for calling attention [to something]) woe to us!, [this is] our destruction! We have indeed been doing wrong’, through [our] disbelief.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They cried) when they were being killed and tormented: (Alas for us! Lo! we were wrong-doers) when we killed our Prophet. 351
